unnormalised: **Social Media & Influencer Marketing: Follower Analytics Get a Desi Twist!**
normalised: social media and influencer marketing follower analytics get a desi twist

unnormalised: Hey folks! Are you tired of generic follower analytics that don't understand the "bindaas" Indian audience? Well, hold onto your samosas! New tools are popping up that finally "get" us.
normalised: hey folks are you tired of generic follower analytics that do not understand the bindaas indian audience well hold onto your samosas new tools are popping up that finally get us

unnormalised: Think detailed reports on how many followers are actually from, say, Pune versus Patiala. Or which content resonates best with Gen Z vs. the older generation in Mumbai.
normalised: think detailed reports on how many followers are actually from say pune versus patiala or which content resonates best with gen z versus the older generation in mumbai

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma, a marketing guru from IIM Bangalore, says these new analytics platforms go beyond simple demographics. They track engagement based on regional slang, festival preferences (Diwali vs. Eid), and even Bollywood trends.
normalised: doctor sharma a marketing guru from I I M bangalore says these new analytics platforms go beyond simple demographics they track engagement based on regional slang festival preferences diwali versus eid and even bollywood trends

unnormalised: Imagine knowing exactly which percentage of your followers are "chai" lovers vs. "coffee" addicts. This stuff is gold, especially for local businesses.
normalised: imagine knowing exactly which percentage of your followers are chai lovers versus coffee addicts this stuff is gold especially for local businesses

unnormalised: Some apps even offer insights into follower spending habits, letting you know if they are more likely to splurge on a Rs. 5000 saree or a fancy phone. We're talking hyper-personalized marketing, ya!
normalised: some apps even offer insights into follower spending habits letting you know if they are more likely to splurge on a rupee five thousand saree or a fancy phone we are talking hyper personalized marketing ya

unnormalised: Expect better ROI on your influencer marketing campaigns, too. No more partnering with influencers whose reach is 80% outside of India when you're selling sarees in 1000 sq ft shops in Chandni Chowk. It is all about hyper-local these days! Get cracking!
normalised: expect better R O I on your influencer marketing campaigns too no more partnering with influencers whose reach is eighty percent outside of india when you are selling sarees in one thousand square feet shops in chandni chowk it is all about hyper local these days get cracking
